summary: Chechnya, officially the Chechen Republic, is a part of Russia located in Eastern Europe's North Caucasus region. After the Soviet Union dissolved in 1991, Chechnya and Ingushetia split, with Chechnya briefly declaring independence. Following two wars, Russia regained control. Now, Chechnya is led by Ramzan Kadyrov. The republic spans 17,300 square kilometers and has over 1.5 million residents, mainly Muslim Chechens. Grozny is its capital and largest city.
title: Chechnya
